content:
AurorusVox Presents
Little Italy Police Department Mafia



It seemed that something just wasn't right for the Little Italy Police Department. They'd had trouble with those scumbag mafiasos before, but recently it seemed that their job was getting that little bit harder. Evidence disappearing. Witnesses changing their story. Criminals walking free on school-boy technicalities. Well, something had to be done. And soon. When the enemy fights dirty, you gotta get down there in the mud with them. No more arrests. Just cold, rough, irreversible justice...

---

MR C. VILLIAN, MURDERED N -29


Detective I. M. Acopp lit the cigarette with a Zippo lighter he pulled from his inside suit pocket. He put it on the table and inhaled slowly. The tip burned bright orange as he eyed the kid sitting opposite him. The Detective leaned in and blew the smoke out into his face. His eyes were cold. The kid coughed and instinctively went to waft the smoke out of his face. He couldn’t; his hands were cuffed to the table, and all he accomplished was to hurt his wrist.
The Detective stood back up and walked over to the other side of the table, where he took off his suit jacket and hung it over the back of his chair. His partner, G. Nerikop, a hard hitting Polish police officer, nodded and dropped a folder on the table. He spoke, his voice as gritty as this description.
“So, Mr...E. Herring. Where were you last night?”
“Where was I? I was, uh, with, my buddy. Yeah.”
“Your buddy, eh? Hear this Ian? With a buddy. Well. This buddy have a name?”
“Course. His name’s Andy. Andy Crumbalot.”
“Crumbalot? The baker?”
“Yeah, yeah.”
“Oh. He was with the baker, Ian. Guess we can let him go.”
The kid’s face lit up – he was going to go free. Detective Acopp walked over to the table and extinguished his cigarette in an ashtray lying next to the folder. He flipped the cover open.
“Funny, Gene. Because county records show Mr. Crumbalot was in hospital last night. With a broken finger.”
Herring’s face drained of colour. “What?!”
“You’re lying to us, Mr. Herring.”
“No! I swear it!”
“The records don’t lie, but people do.”
“There’s been a mistake, I mean, I was with him, last night!”
Detective Acopp turned and looked at his reflection in the mirror that ran the width of the room. He jerked his head backwards, gesturing towards the pale kid trembling in the chair behind him.
“Lock this piece of shit up.”

MR. EDWARD HERRING, WRONGFULLY DETAINED N -25

---

Just over three weeks later, Acopp stormed into the police station, heading straight to his partners desk. He flung a newspaper at him, opened to an inside page showing a full colour picture of young Edward Herring on the steps of the courthouse building.
“Hey. You remember that kid we collared a few weeks ago for murder? He was in court yesterday. Would you believe it? His alibi checked out. That baker, the one we couldn’t find, the one he said he was with – he never broke his finger. The county hospital have no records of a Mr. Crumbalot visiting them the night of the murder. We were duped.”
“What? But the records-”
“The records were falsified, gentlemen.”
The voice was gravel; its owner had clearly spent years drinking whiskey out of empty cigarette boxes after smoking the whole lot in one sitting. It was so gritty that even his tongue must have had its own stubble.
“Excuse me, but who are you?”
“They call me A. V. I’m just a man with a maverick disregard for the rulebook and a tragic backstory that would be revealed in a flashback episode if this were a TV show. And I’ve been following these scumbags for a long, long time. Forget everythin’ you thought you knew. There’s no longer time to go through the courts. Are you listenin’? We’re throwin’ procedure out the window here. No more handcuffs. If we don’t do somethin’ soon, Little Italy is going to the wolves – and they ain’t friendly critters either. You ever killed a man with rabies, boy? You ain’t never looked death in the eye ‘til it’s drippin’ from the teeth of an enraged rabies victim, I’ll tell you that much. And that’s where we’re headed. Unless you listen to me and listen real good. Over the years I’ve narrowed the scumbags down to somewhere amongst this list of people. But our badge ain’t no good any more, you hear? We gotta let natural justice take its course. Announce to the people of Little Italy that we’re looking for the killers, and then “accidentally” leak the document. I can guarantee you that the people on that list will take matters into their own hands to prove they’re innocent – I mean, living here, what more do you expect? We’ve done our part, gentleman. Now alls we can do is wait and watch as this town finds and kills the scumbags for us – or destroys itself trying.”

POLICE DOCUMENT, LEAKED N0

AurorusVox's Ruleset (stolen with minor modifications from VasudeVa)On Gameplay

    1. I have the final say in any form of dispute.
    2. Although I am the moderator, I am not infallible. Feel free to point out any mistake by PMing me or by a bolded message in thread.
    3. The moderator lieks Pansy Purple for important things (more specifically, #8800BF). Don't use that colour. This is a modkillable offense.
    4. All game-related communication between the mod and players STAY between that mod and that player. This is a modkillable offense.
    5. All game-related communication between players STAY in the thread unless specifically stated in the Role PMs. This is a modkillable offense.
    6. Falsifying the mod is a modkillable offense. I am the sole judge of whether I have been falsified or not.
    7. Small or invisible text as a secret communication is disallowed. Cryptography is also disallowed.
    8. Loopholes are bad and pretty dick-ish. Modkills ensue.
    9. Modkills revert the player's role into a Neutral Survivor; they then die a painful death, therefore losing themselves the game and embarrassing their family.

On Voting, Activity and Deadlines

    1. Please aim to post at least once a day. (The more the merrier!)
    2. V/LAs are to be announced in thread and bolded.
    3. Players who don't post in 48 hours will be prodded. Players have 24 hours to respond to a prod or they will be replaced. Players may request prods on a specific player via a bolded message in thread.
    4. A 'three strikes and you're out' rule on prods and replacement is enforced. That is, three prods and you're force replaced.
    5. This game has two week deadlines at the beginning of each game day. Keep in mind that your mod is a busy (and handsome) man so I may be a little flexible on this. There will be deadline countdowns to help enforce this.
    6. Votes/Unvotes may be done either by bolding your Votes or using Vote tags. If you don't use tags, Colons (:) make my life a lot easier. Usernames may be shortened but it has to be easily discernible. Example: Vote: Vas or VOTE: AV
    7. Unvotes are nice but not required.
    8. Lynches need a majority to go through. (That's half the number of living players +1). A No lynch needs 50% of the votes.
    9. A No Lynch will happen at deadline without a full lynch majority.
    10. Once you're dead, please don't post.
    12. The Lynched may speak during Twilight (ie. before the mod posts the death scene). Once the death scene has been posted, s/he may no longer post.
    13. No Bah! Posts.
    14. Play to Win!


---

You are a Vanilla Townie.
You have no abilities other than your voice and your vote.

You are aligned with the Town and win when all the threats to the Town have been eliminated and at least one town member remains alive.

Good Luck!


---

I'd also like to extend my thanks to Hoopla, SpyreX and farside22 for reviewing the set-up!

Modkilled (none so far)

Everyone has picked up their role PM and most people have Confirmed!
DAY ONE IS UNDERWAY!


Thirteen people. Thirteen people gathered in the town square, looking at each other with distrust in their eyes. Some of them, perhaps, were worried. Others thought they'd be safe.
"We've all seen this list."
"It names the whole lot of us!"
"It must be you!"
"No, you!"
Fighting broke out amongst the gathering - a messy, messy affair. Then, one gritty, grizzly voice cut across the din;
"Silence!! You will figure this out like civilised people. Look, here. I have provided you with a noose - find the criminals, and hang them out to dry! Hahaha...*cough*splutter*cough* (I really need to cut down on those cigarettes) Enough from me - organise yourselves! Select one from amongst you! You have two weeks..."
With that, the mysterious voice stopped, and the people looked at each other, stunned for a moment.
And then it began.

I disagree with SGR's "hey let's get the cop to investigate!", because:

  1. The logical continuation of SGR's plan would be for a Cop to out themselves tomorrow if they had a guilty on Diamond.
  2. Therefore, if we don't hear from anybody screaming that they had a guilty on Diamond, we would have to assume that the Cop had an innocent on Diamond.
  3. This is not necessarily the case - the Cop could have been Roleblocked, so actually Diamond could still be scum, but we would have to clear him for at least that day (otherwise what's the point of the plan?)
  4. To add insult to injury, in the case that the roleblock came from scum (and Diamond is scum), they now have:
    1. Confirmation of who is Cop (through lack of a guilty)
    2. A scumbuddy who is cleared(-ish)
  5. When (as is likely in that situation) the Cop dies the next night, we're left not knowing whether the Diamond investigation was sucessful or not. We'd probably have to assume that Diamond was town - otherwise there's no point in carrying out the plan anyway.

The only way to remove those issues would be to get the Cop to out himself regardless of result, which is stupid.

It also seems like a huge waste of a Cop (because if he outs himself that's in all likelihood the only investigation he'll get) to tell us that Diamond is scum.

The crowd would not listen. They advanced, pushed, shoved. Derek Dillium attempted to scramble away, but the surge of bodies was too much, and he fell to the floor. "I...I just don't know. I think you're all pretty darn disgusting...you proletariats just don't do it for me. I say we take the gentleman's way out and postpone the duel of wits anon!" quipped Hislop Duke-Raleigh, doffing his top-hat as he spoke.
"No" said Steven L. Acksi.
"No" said Henric Posta.
"No" said Steven Gerrard-Ayzee.
"No" said Victor van Famm.
Gerrard-Ayzee was the first to break the silence. Unfortunately, since he was part Liverpudlian, people found it hard to understand him. He asked the town to wait whilst a translator was flown in from the Culture Capital - but it seemed his flight had been delayed.
Meanwhile, Bulgarian wrestling sensation Victor van Famm had to be rushed to hospital after a nasty accident involving a ballerina, a tube of extra-fresh toothpaste and a bowling ball. He was out of commission for the foreseeable future, and so it was up to the rag-tag bunch of lovable rogues to finish in his place.
Perhaps it was jealousy at his footballing skills that made the rest of the town turn on poor Steven Gerrard-Ayzee. But even his forged passport - altered to mimic the name of the England international who he so admired - was not enough to stem the tide of mistrust.
Nooses were waggled.
The crowd came closer.
Steven Gerrard-Ayzee was strung up with little resistance. Steven L. Acksi, outraged that another person would share his forename, tied the final knot, utilising years of practice built up in his chino factory to ensure death would be swift at hand.
As Gerrard-Ayzee fell to the floor, a gun slipped out of his pocket.
Henric Posta wandered closer. Everyone could feel the former priest's pure heart and clear soul as he inspected the weapon. Somehow, the holy man was an expert on firearms - he declared that it was the very same weapon that had killed countless times before.
It seemed the town would be safe.
It seemed that the terror...was over.

Mod Thoughts

The Game!
Town smashed it D1 and D2, though to be fair to the scum, they managed to ride two claims out of y'all. This basically painted a huge target on the LLD slot, so that went well for them, I think.
Y'all got very trigger happy with the back-to-back scum lynches, and poor Wicked didn't manage to post at all D2 or D3. Neither did Hoppster, your confirmed town. It worked out fine in the end though, and I suppose you can tell a lot from how people react to the lolwagons.
SGR did well to last that long, though from his most recent post it sounds as though the Hindu x AGM masterplan was entirely accidental. If Hindu/AGM had been lynched on D4 instead of SaM, SGR might have had a decent chance of pulling through to the end. As it stood, PoE really kicked his ass.

Controversies!
I realise that I shouldn't have allowed the Riddick replacement, since I'd banned them in the sign-up thread. I apologise if this had a huge impact on the game, but I was caught at a very...shall we say, merry...time.
The big bomb though was the code that AGM used. I don't really see any other way that I could have handled that - the scum team didn't actually decode it, despite the tools being there, whereas Hindu did - though I think he probably would have, given his involvement in DEFCON 3.0 anyway. If it makes a difference, the Riddick Hydra did NOT attempt to decode the message.

Set up!
I take on board that this may have been too cop-themed for the normal queue. It did start out with a bunch more cop-fitting PRs (Framers, GFs, Backup Cops) but they all got balanced out to make it less swingy. I think that's a good thing, actually - it was nice seeing the vanillas at the end working without PRs, and in fact, looking at how the PRs dropped suspicion on people.
I almost wish that Hindu had been right in his crazier theories, since they were definitely thinking outside of the box in terms of set-up, which I liked.
The JK's ability to clear people was NOT something I had actively considered when making the setup, since I didn't count on scum flying solo by N2. It definitely added a different dynamic to the game and could have been TOO powerful in combination with the cop clears. It was initially meant to be a way to neuter the effectiveness of town PRs since it was the only protective role, but obv. couldn't be used to save PRs.
The EN Vig was made EN on purpose so it only got its shot if it made it to N2. Initially there was a counterpart Odd-Night SK, but the stacks of anti-town kills on the first night was weighted out of the game. Its a shame Riddick never shot, though it would have actually cost town a mislynch.
The Miller was meant to hinder town, but it basically gave them a clear from the get-go. Millers as an anti-town force is not as effective as I'd hoped it would be! Maybe if they were not told they were millers, it would have been a lot more scum-sided.
As for the GF - or lack thereof - obviously if SGR had rolled GF in his situation he would have been able to leave AGM alive and prey on GF fears. BUT, what I think is especially interesting, is the fact that there was not GF, but people assumed there was. Had AGM investigated SGR, then obviously it would have been different, but here, I think the lack of GF really helped scum in instilling a sense of paranoia. My thinking is, if Diamond had rolled GF and flipped it on D1, then every investigate of AGM's would have been cleared. As it stood, you couldn't trust any of them. That was something I really hadn't expected!

Well, I hope you all enjoyed the game! I really enjoyed modding it, and finding my signature vote count format :p I don't think I'll be naming each of the VCs in the future - far too hard to come up with cool one-liners on the spot! Giving you all names and little personalities was pretty fun too! Finding replacements wasn't as hard as I'd thought, but I nevertheless want to extend a HUGE thank you to all those who replaced in.

~AV
